DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : Primary - To evaluate safety tolerability sorafenib tosylate therapy administer doxorubicin hydrochloride-based hepatic arterial chemoembolization ( HACE ) assess NCI CTCAE v3.0 patient localize unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma . Secondary - To determine sorafenib tosylate decrease number HACE treatment require achieve radiologic tumor kill . - To assess improvement progression-free survival . - To assess change monthly AFP level patient AFP-producing tumor . - To measure VEGF level . OUTLINE : Patients receive oral sorafenib tosylate twice daily day 1-14 . Beginning ≥ 3 day later , patient undergo hepatic arterial chemoembolization ( HACE ) * doxorubicin hydrochloride mitomycin C. Beginning ≥ 3 day completion HACE and/or liver function return baseline , patient resume sorafenib tosylate twice daily 6 month absence disease progression unacceptable toxicity . NOTE : *Patients may undergo one HACE treatment . Blood sample collect periodically laboratory analysis .
